content: Passaic River at Newark, New Jersey, where, as of late September 2020, 15,000 of 18,000 miles of aging lead service pipes on private land have been replaced, with more to go in pursuit of safer drinking water for the city’s residents…“Simply put, there are no safe levels of lead”—Erik Olson, senior strategic director for Health at the Natural Resource Defense Council (NRDC)__no.0593, 2020.  #leadpipes #safedrinkingwater #replacingleadpipes
